sen.j: 鞍馬電気鉄道株式会社（くらまでんきてつどう）は、現京都市左京区の山端（現：宝ヶ池駅）から鞍馬駅への鉄道路線を運営していた鉄道会社。
sen.e: Kurama Denki Tetsudo Kabushiki Kaisha (Kurama Electric Railway Company Limited) was a railway company who operated a railway line from Yamabana (current Takaragaike Station) in present Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, to Kurama Station.

Kurama Denki Tetsudo Kabushiki Kaisha (Kurama Electric Railway Company Limited) was a railway company that operated a railway line from Yamabana (current Takaragaike Station) in present Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, to Kurama Station.

Kurama Denki Tetsudo Kabushiki Kaisha (Kurama Electric Railway Company Limited) was a railway company that operated a railway line from Yamabana (current Takaragaike Station) in present Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, to Kurama Station.

sen.j: この鉄道路線は、現在では叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線となっている。
sen.e: This railway line is now operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. as their Kurama Line.
This railway line is now operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. as their Kurama Line.
This railway line is now operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. as their Kurama Line.

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）12月1日 京都電燈株式会社の子会社として設立され、1928年（昭和3年）12月1日に営業を開始。
sen.e: Kurama Denki Tetsudo was established on December 1, 1927, as a subsidiary company of an electric power corporation Kyoto Dento, and inaugurated services on December 1, 1928.
Kurama Denki Tetsudo was established on December 1, 1927, as a subsidiary company of an electric power corporation Kyoto Dento, and inaugurated services on December 1, 1928.
December 1, 1927: Kurama Denki Tetsudo was established as a subsidiary company of an electric power corporation Kyoto Dento, and inaugurated services on December 1, 1928.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 京福電気鉄道に合併している。
sen.e: It merged with Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. on August 1, 1942,
It merged with Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. on August 1, 1942,
August 1, 1942: It merged with Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）12月1日 京都電燈の子会社として設立。
sen.e: On December 1, 1927, Kurama Denki Tetsudo (Kurama Electric Railway) was established as a subsidiary company of an electric power corporation Kyoto Dento.
On December 1, 1927, Kurama Denki Tetsudo (Kurama Electric Railway) was established as a subsidiary company of an electric power corporation Kyoto Dento.
December 1, 1927: Kurama Denki Tetsudo (Kurama Electric Railway) was established as a subsidiary company of an electric power corporation Kyoto Dento.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）12月1日 山端（現在の宝ヶ池） - 市原間 (5.3km) が開業。
sen.e: On December 1, 1928, the company inaugurated services for the section (5.3 kilometer) between Yamabana (current Takaragaike) and Ichihara.
On December 1, 1928, the company inaugurated services for the section (5.3 kilometer) between Yamabana (current Takaragaike) and Ichihara.
December 1, 1928: The company inaugurated services for the section (5.3 kilometer) between Yamabana (current Takaragaike) and Ichihara.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 車両は叡山電鉄デナ21形電車の4両を所有。
sen.e: It possessed four electric railcars, type DENA 21, of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
It possessed four electric railcars, type DENA 21, of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
It possessed four electric railcars, type DENA 21, of Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）10月20日 市原 - 鞍馬仮間 (3.1km) が開業。
sen.e: On October 20, 1929, it began services for the section (3.1 kilometers) between Ichihara and Kurama-kari (temporary station of Kurama).
On October 20, 1929, it began services for the section (3.1 kilometers) between Ichihara and Kurama-kari (temporary station of Kurama).
October 20, 1929: It began services for the section (3.1 kilometers) between Ichihara and Kurama-kari (temporary station of Kurama).
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: デナ21形2両を増備。
sen.e: It additionally introduced two electric railcars, type DENA.
It additionally introduced two electric railcars, type DENA.
It additionally introduced two electric railcars, type DENA.

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）12月20日 鞍馬仮 - 鞍馬間 (0.4km) が開業し全通(8.8km)。
sen.e: On December 20, 1929, the company started operation of a section between Kurama-kari and Kurama (0.4 kilometers) whereby the company became able to offer full services for the whole line (8.8 kilometers).

On December 20, 1929, the company started operation of a section between Kurama-kari and Kurama (0.4 kilometers) whereby the company became able to offer full services for the whole line (8.8 kilometers).

December 20, 1929: The company started operation of a section between Kurama-kari and Kurama (0.4 kilometers) whereby the company became able to offer full services for the whole line (8.8 kilometers).
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 鞍馬仮駅廃止。
sen.e: The station of Kurama-kari was abolished.
The station of Kurama-kari was abolished.
The station of Kurama-kari was abolished.

sen.j: 京都電燈叡山電鉄線（現・叡山電鉄叡山本線）に山端駅から乗り入れ、同線の出町柳駅まで直通運転を開始。
sen.e: The company extended its line from Yamabana station direct to Demachiyanagi station of Eizan Dentetsu line by entering into the line of Eizan Dentetsu of Kyoto Dento (current Eizan Mainline of Eizan Dentetsu).

The company extended its line from Yamabana station direct to Demachiyanagi station of the Eizan Dentetsu line by entering into the line of Eizan Dentetsu of Kyoto Dento (current Eizan Mainline of Eizan Dentetsu).

The company extended its line from Yamabana Station direct to Demachiyanagi Station of the Eizan Dentetsu line by entering into the line of Eizan Dentetsu of Kyoto Dento (current Eizan Mainline of Eizan Dentetsu).

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）2月 集電方式を架空単線式に変更。
sen.e: In February of 1930, its power collection system was changed to an overhead single wire system.
In February of 1930, its power collection system was changed to an overhead single wire system.
February of 1930: Its power collection system was changed to an overhead single wire system.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年） 洛北自動車株式会社（後の京都バスの洛北方面）を買収。
sen.e: In 1930, the company purchased Rakuhoku Jidosha Kabushiki Kaisha (Rakuhoku Auto Company Limited, later Rakuhoku Areal Office of Kyoto Bus).
In 1930, the company purchased Rakuhoku Jidosha Kabushiki Kaisha (Rakuhoku Auto Company Limited, later Rakuhoku Areal Office of Kyoto Bus).
1930: The company purchased Rakuhoku Jidosha Kabushiki Kaisha (Rakuhoku Auto Company Limited, later Rakuhoku Areal Office of Kyoto Bus).
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 猛烈な乗客争奪合戦を繰り広げ、これが諸般の弊害を生じる結果となり、結局買収するに至った。
sen.e: This buyout was made as a result of various adverse effects caused by fierce competition to attract passengers between the two companies.
This buyout was made as a result of various adverse effects caused by fierce competition to attract passengers between the two companies.
This buyout was made as a result of various adverse effects caused by fierce competition to attract passengers between the two companies.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年） （旧）京阪電気鉄道が全株式を京都電燈に譲渡。
sen.e: In 1931, (former) Keihan Electric Railway transferred its all stocks to Kyoto Dento.
In 1931, (former) Keihan Electric Railway transferred all its stocks to Kyoto Dento.
1931: (Former) Keihan Electric Railway transferred all its stocks to Kyoto Dento.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 同社の傍系会社になる。
sen.e: It became an affiliate of Kyoto Dento.
It became an affiliate of Kyoto Dento.
It became an affiliate of Kyoto Dento.

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年） 雲ヶ畑バス株式会社（後の京都バスの雲ヶ畑方面）を買収。
sen.e: In 1933, it bought out Kumogahata Bus Kabushiki Kaisha (Kumogahata Bus Company Limited, later Kumogahata Areal Office of Kyoto Bus).
In 1933, it bought out Kumogahata Bus Kabushiki Kaisha (Kumogahata Bus Company Limited, later Kumogahata Areal Office of Kyoto Bus).
1933: It bought out Kumogahata Bus Kabushiki Kaisha (Kumogahata Bus Company Limited, later Kumogahata Areal Office of Kyoto Bus).
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 洛北自動車同様の経緯。
sen.e: This buyout took a process similar to the case of Rakuhoku Jidosha.
This buyout took a process similar to the case of Rakuhoku Jidosha.
This buyout took a process similar to the case of Rakuhoku Jidosha.

sen.j: これにて洛北を走る交通機関の調整を見るに至った。
sen.e: By this event, adjustment of traffic facilities in Rakuhoku area was completed.
By this event, adjustment of traffic facilities in the Rakuhoku area was completed.
By this event, adjustment of traffic facilities in the Rakuhoku area was completed.

sen.j: 1939年（昭和14年）9月 二軒茶屋 - 市原間が単線化（不要不急線指定に基づくものではない）。
sen.e: In September of 1939, the section between Nikenchaya and Ichihara was altered to single track railroad, though not because of designation of nonessential and nonurgent lines.
During September of 1939, the section between Nikenchaya and Ichihara was altered to a single track railroad, though not because of the designation of nonessential and nonurgent lines.
September, 1939: The section between Nikenchaya and Ichihara was altered to a single track railroad, though not because of the designation of nonessential and nonurgent lines.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 親会社の京都電燈が配電統制令に基づき発送電事業を日本発送電、配電事業を関西電力の前身の関西配電に譲渡して解散した。
sen.e: On March 2, 1942, its parent company, Kyoto Dento, became dissolved according to the government's ordinance to cotrol power distribution, and transfered its power generation and transmission business to Japan Electric Generation and Transmission Company, and its power distribution business to Kansai Haiden, the predecessor of Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On March 2, 1942, its parent company, Kyoto Dento, dissolved according to the government's ordinance to control power distribution, and transfered its power generation and transmission business to Japan Electric Generation and Transmission Company, and its power distribution business to Kansai Haiden, the predecessor of Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc.

March 2, 1942: Its parent company, Kyoto Dento, dissolved according to the government's ordinance to control power distribution, and transfered its power generation and transmission business to Japan Electric Generation and Transmission Company, and its power distribution business to Kansai Haiden, the predecessor of Kansai Electric Power Co., Inc.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: これに伴い、鉄軌道部門を分離して京福電気鉄道を設立。
sen.e: At the same time, Kyoto Dento separated its railway business to a newly established Keifuku Denki Tetsudo (Keifuku Electric Railway).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the same time, Kyoto Dento separated its railway business to a newly established Keifuku Denki Tetsudo (Keifuku Electric Railway).
At the same time, Kyoto Dento separated its railway business to a newly established Keifuku Denki Tetsudo (Keifuku Electric Railway).

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 京福電気鉄道に合併。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942, Keifuku Denki Tetsudo merged with Kurama Denki Tetsudo.
On August 1, 1942, Keifuku Denki Tetsudo merged with Kurama Denki Tetsudo.
August 1, 1942: Keifuku Denki Tetsudo merged with Kurama Denki Tetsudo.
sen.cmt: 表記を年月日： に変更

sen.j: 鉄道路線は同社鞍馬線となる。
sen.e: Accordingly, the railway line of Kurama Denki Tetsudo became the Kurama Line of Keifuku Dentetsu
Accordingly, the railway line of Kurama Denki Tetsudo became the Kurama Line of Keifuku Dentetsu
Accordingly, the railway line of Kurama Denki Tetsudo became the Kurama Line of Keifuku Dentetsu.

sen.j: データは全通時のもの。
sen.e: The data are dated back to the time of completion of whole lines.
The data dates back to the time of the completion of all lines.
The data dates back to the time of the completion of all lines.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄鞍馬線 山端（現：宝ヶ池駅） - 鞍馬駅 8.8km 9駅
sen.e: Kurama Line of Eizan Dentetsu: From Yamabana (current Takaragaike) to Kurama Station, 8.8 km long with nine stations
Kurama Line of Eizan Dentetsu: From Yamabana (current Takaragaike) to Kurama Station, 8.8 km long with nine stations

sen.j: 軌間：1435mm
sen.e: Track gauge: 1435mm
Track gauge: 1435mm
Track gauge: 1435mm

sen.j: 複線区間：宝ヶ池 - 市原間
sen.e: Double tracked section: Between Takaragaike and Ichihara
Double tracked section: Between Takaragaike and Ichihara
Double tracked section: Between Takaragaike and Ichihara

sen.j: 電化区間：全線電化（直流600V、架空複線方式）
sen.e: Electrified section: Whole line (direct current of 600 volts, overhead double wire system)
Electrified section: Complete line (direct current of 600 volts, overhead double wire system)
Electrified section: Complete line (direct current of 600 volts, overhead double wire system)

sen.j: 車庫：1（木野駅隣接）
sen.e: Garage: 1 (adjacent to Kino Station)
Garage: One (adjacent to Kino Station)
Garage: One (adjacent to Kino Station)

sen.j: デナ21形120番台の6両を新造、所有していた。
sen.e: Six units of newly built electric railcars, Type DENA 21, with car numbers of 120s.
Six units of newly built electric railcars, Type DENA 21, with car numbers in the 120s.
Six units of newly built electric railcars, Type DENA 21, with car numbers in the 120s.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄デナ21形電車
sen.e: Electric railcars of Eizan Dentetsu DENA 21
Electric railcars of Eizan Dentetsu DENA 21
Electric railcars of Eizan Dentetsu DENA 21

sen.j: ほとんどの列車が叡山線出町柳駅から直通運転していた。
sen.e: Almost all trains depart directly from Demachiyanagi station of Eizan Line.
Almost all trains depart directly from Demachiyanagi station on the Eizan Line.
Almost all trains depart directly from Demachiyanagi jStation on the Eizan Line.

sen.j: 主に電気ブレーキを装備した自社の車両が鞍馬までの運転、叡山線の車両が比較的平坦な二軒茶屋までの区間運転に用いられていたが、叡山線所有のデナ21形も鞍馬まで乗り入れることがあった。
sen.e: Mainly Kurama Denki Tetsudo's own cars, equipped with electric brakes, were operated upto Kurama, while cars of Eizan Line were running on the comparatively flat section upto Nikenchaya, but sometimes electric cars, Type DENA 21 of Eizan Line were also used upto Kurama.

Mainly Kurama Denki Tetsudo's own cars, equipped with electric brakes, were operated up to Kurama, while cars on the Eizan Line were running on a comparatively flat section up to Nikenchaya, but sometimes electric cars, Type DENA 21 of Eizan Line were also used up to Kurama.

Mainly Kurama Denki Tetsudo's own cars, equipped with electric brakes, were operated up to Kurama, while cars on the Eizan Line were running on a comparatively flat section up to Nikenchaya, but sometimes electric cars, Type DENA 21 of Eizan Line were also used up to Kurama.

sen.j: 一般的には叡山線と別会社という認識は薄く、一体で「叡電」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: Generally, Eizan Line and Kurama Denki Tetsudo were not distictly acknowledged, but rather known as "Eiden" as a unit.
Generally, the Eizan Line and Kurama Denki Tetsudo were not distinctly acknowledged, but rather known as "Eiden" as a unit.
Generally, the Eizan Line and Kurama Denki Tetsudo were not distinctly acknowledged, but rather known as 'Eiden' as a unit.

sen.j: 現在も京都バスの社章として使われている羽うちわのマークは、元々は鞍馬電鉄の社紋であったものが引き継がれている。
sen.e: At present, too, the Kyoto Bus has assumed from Kurama Dentetsu its corporate mark of Japanese fan made of feathers, and adopted it as its corporate emblem.
At present, too, the Kyoto Bus has assumed from Kurama Dentetsu its corporate mark of a Japanese fan made of feathers, and adopted it as its corporate emblem.
At present, too, the Kyoto Bus has assumed from Kurama Dentetsu its corporate mark of a Japanese fan made of feathers, and adopted it as its corporate emblem.
